item.title: Europe Wanted to Lead the World on EVs. Its Carmakers Can’t Keep Up
item.description: The lack of cheap EVs and the reliance on combustion engines is putting Europe’s plan to ban new petrol cars by 2035 at risk.

item.title: Does Dry January Really Make People Healthier?
item.description: Abstaining from alcohol can have immediate benefits. But lasting gains require lasting change.

item.title: 10 More of the Coolest Things We’ve Seen at CES 2025
item.description: More of the wild ideas and clever innovations we’re seeing this week at tech’s big show in Las Vegas.

item.title: Correcting Genetic Spelling Errors With Next-Generation Crispr
item.description: Treatments for rare diseases are hard to create and expensive to deliver, but there is new hope for editing the software of the genome.

item.title: Satellites Can Now Identify Methane ‘Super-Emitters’
item.description: Two eyes in the sky are now trained on Earth, locating the worst offenders for releasing methane, wherever they may be.
